AdiShankaracharya.Role: Philosopher, Theologian, Founder of Advaita Vedanta
PhilosophicalThemes: Advaita Vedanta: Brahman alone is real; world is Maya

KeyTeachings.Description: Non-dual reality; Brahman is the only truth, world is illusory
Cosmic illusion that veils true knowledge
Path of knowledge leading to liberation

TextsAndVerses.Name: Advaita Mahavakya
TextsAndVerses.Verse: ब्रह्म सत्यं जगन्मिथ्या जीवो ब्रह्मैव नापरः।
TextsAndVerses.Transliteration: Brahma Satyam Jaganmithya Jivo Brahmaiva Na Aparah
TextsAndVerses.Meaning: Brahman is real, the world is illusory, and the individual soul is none other than Brahman.

TextsAndVerses.Name: Vivekachudamani
TextsAndVerses.Meaning: I am not the mind, intellect, ego, or memory; I am pure consciousness.

TextsAndVerses.Name: Bhaja Govindam
TextsAndVerses.Verse: भज गोविन्दं भज गोविन्दं गोविन्दं भज मूढमते।
TextsAndVerses.Transliteration: Bhaja Govindam Bhaja Govindam Govindam Bhaja Moodhamate
TextsAndVerses.Meaning: Worship Govinda, O fool! When death comes, grammar rules will not save you.

Timeline.Event: Born in Kaladi, Kerala; showed spiritual inclination early
Took Sannyasa at a young age; became disciple of Govinda Bhagavatpada
Defeated rival schools; established Advaita supremacy
Established four monastic centers across India
Authored commentaries on Upanishads, Gita, Brahma Sutras; wrote devotional hymns
